result.value:
bibentry(bibtype="article",
    title = "Per-sample standardization and asymmetric winsorization lead to accurate clustering of RNA-seq expression profiles",
    author = personList(
        person(given="Davide", family="Risso"),
        person(given="Stefano", middle="Maria", family="Pagnotta")
    ),
    year = 2021,
    journal = "Bioinformatics",
    doi = "10.1093/bioinformatics/btab091"
)
This package implements the AWST method presented in [Risso and Pagnotta (2020)](https://doi.org/10.1101/2020.06.04.134916).

result.description: This release contains the version of `awst` used to generate all the results of [Risso and Pagnotta (2021)](https://doi.org/10.1093/bioinformatics/btab091)
result.name: Version of awst used for the results of the paper

result.value:
The AWST transformation can be applied either directly on raw counts, or (recommended) to normalized counts. The input should be either a matrix with genes in rows and samples in columns or a SummarizedExperiment object.

```{r}
library(awst)
xt <- awst(x)
```

For detailed examples and use cases see the vignette and https://github.com/drisso/awst_analysis.
